intro: Jatropha sympetala, commonly known as the Mexican cup plant, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often toxic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped inflorescences that are typically yellow or orange in color. Jatropha sympetala is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in full sun and well-drained soil. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are hairy and upright.
